The Pope is on a feeding tube. He can't talk. He can barely move. Should he get the Schiavo treatment and be allowed to starve to death?
Let's see how he's doing in a few decades, then decide.

The Pope is on a feeding tube. He can't talk. He can barely move. Should he get the Schiavo treatment and be allowed to starve to death?

 The pope still has nuero electric brain activity, Schiavo doens't even have that. Here frontal cortex is truening to spinal fliud. You have just made the connection of the feeding tube and thought they are similar but they are not even the same ball field, really not even the same sport. Nice try!

Hey! Your frontal Cortex and or time spend on a feeding tube make you more or less of a person!! Thats awesome. My roommates frontal cortex is so much smaller then mine..I will be right back while I look him in room and starve him

I have not watched this situation that closely, but gut tells me we can butt out. It's OK to die. There is a time for it. We all have to. If you have strong feelings about that, get a living will, otherwise it's the hands of people who can only guess your wishes.
 
 If I were in a state such as Terri's, I would hope my loved ones would have the strength to let me go.

It's difficult to see why the pope would cling on to life in extremis (if that's what he is doing). As the principal Catholic believer in immortality, it seems likely that he would welcome an early entry to Paradise.
